org.jgrapes.io.util

Class ManagedCharBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapes.io.util.ManagedBuffer<CharBuffer>
      • org.jgrapes.io.util.ManagedCharBuffer

  • public class ManagedCharBuffer
extends ManagedBuffer<CharBuffer>

    A specialized ManagedBuffer<CharBuffer> that provides the same methods as CharBuffer by delegating to the backing buffer.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ManagedCharBuffer.Reader
      A reader for the buffers content.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ManagedCharBuffer EMPTY_BUFFER
      An empty buffer usable instead of null.

      • Fields inherited from class org.jgrapes.io.util.ManagedBuffer

        backing

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ManagedCharBuffer(CharBuffer buffer, BufferCollector manager)
      Creates new managed buffer that is backed by the given buffer and uses the given manager to release the buffer if it is no longer locked.
      ManagedCharBuffer(CharSequence backing)
      Creates a new managed buffer that is backed by the given char sequence.

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY_BUFFER

        public static final ManagedCharBuffer EMPTY_BUFFER

        An empty buffer usable instead of null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ManagedCharBuffer

        public ManagedCharBuffer(CharBuffer buffer,
                         BufferCollector manager)

        Creates new managed buffer that is backed by the given buffer and uses the given manager to release the buffer if it is no longer locked.

        Parameters:
        buffer - the backing buffer
        manager - the manager

      • ManagedCharBuffer

        public ManagedCharBuffer(CharSequence backing)

        Creates a new managed buffer that is backed by the given char sequence. The manager for this instance does nothing when the buffer is released.

        Parameters:
        backing - the backing buffer
